intro: Vleckia foeniculum, commonly known as sweet fennel, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and a tall, slender stem that bears small yellow flowers. The plant is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its aromatic seeds and as a culinary herb. Vleckia foeniculum is also valued in traditional medicine for its digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
